intro: Anthospermum cameroonense, commonly known as the Cameroon starflower, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
